What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Atherosclerosis of renal artery

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 58 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- An unexplained increase in blood pressure
- Difficulty controlling your blood pressure with medications
- Reduced kidney function during treatment for hypertension
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
Over the past few months, my blood pressure has been rising steadily, despite taking multiple medications. Recently, my doctor noticed my kidney function was declining during routine tests, and I’ve been feeling more fatigued and sometimes have swelling in my ankles. It all started gradually about four months ago, but the hypertension has become harder to control, even with adjustments to my meds. I have a history of high blood pressure in my family, and I also have diabetes, which I know increases my risk.

It’s kind of strange because it used to be okay, but now I feel tired all the time and my ankles get swollen sometimes. My family has had high blood pressure, so I think it’s been a problem for a while, but recently it’s been worse, and I don’t know what’s going on.
